summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2024 discussing a tasking from the Office of Congressional Affairs (OCA) regarding questions for the FBI Director about the Epstein investigation. The emails request a timeline and summary of the FBI's investigation into Epstein, specifically regarding flight logs and CSAM allegations, to prepare the Director for an upcoming congressional engagement.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: The FBI Director who was questioned by Senator John Kennedy about the Epstein investigation during a Senate Appropriations hearing on June 4, 2024. His responses from that hearing are quoted in the email chain.

persons.name: John Kennedy
persons.context: Senator who questioned FBI Director Christopher Wray about the Epstein investigation during a Senate Appropriations hearing on June 4, 2024, specifically asking about investigations into other people involved and the existence of surveillance tapes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased individual at the center of the sex trafficking and CSAM investigation. The FBI's investigation into his activities, including flight logs, is the subject of the congressional inquiry and internal tasking.

persons.name: Ms. Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as Epstein's associate, now in prison, who was engaged in the conspiracy of sex trafficking with minors.

connections.description: Described as associates engaged in a conspiracy of sex trafficking with minors.
Senator Kennedy questioned Director Wray during a Senate Appropriations Committee hearing about the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Senate Appropriations Hearing with FBI Director
events.description: FBI Director Christopher Wray testified before the Senate Appropriations Committee. Senator John Kennedy questioned him about the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and other potential co-conspirators, specifically asking about surveillance tapes.

events.title: Deadline for FBI Internal Tasking
events.description: Internal deadline for the FBI's Violent Crimes Against Children Section to provide a timeline and summary of the Epstein investigation to the Director's Office, in response to a congressional inquiry tasking.

keyFacts: The FBI's Office of Congressional Affairs (OCA) tasked internal divisions in July 2024 to prepare the FBI Director for potential questions from a member of Congress about Epstein flight logs and the investigation.

The FBI states it conducted a 'full and thorough investigation' into allegations that Epstein and others produced, possessed, and/or distributed Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM), which included a review of flight logs and dozens of pieces of evidence.
Flight logs were used as exhibits during the trial and are public record, with minor victim names redacted.

During a June 4, 2024 Senate hearing, Senator Kennedy pressed Director Wray on whether the FBI had surveillance tapes from Epstein's homes and island that allegedly recorded sex acts with prominent people for potential blackmail.
Director Wray declined to comment on specifics of law enforcement operations or investigations extending to other people beyond Epstein and Maxwell.
